title: How to Create Ethereum Smart Contracts
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Detailed technical guide for creating Ethereum smart contracts including genesis block configuration, geth commands, Solidity programming, and deployment via Remix IDE

chainId.purpose: Send transactions that work on ethereum without working on ETC or testnets
chainId.note: Use unused number like 15 for private chains

homesteadBlock.meaning: Using Ethereum Homestead release (2nd major release)

eip155Block.eip_definition: Ethereum Improvement Proposals - standards for platform

difficulty.impact: Lower = faster block times for testing

gasLimit.mechanism: Each EVM instruction costs specific gas
gasLimit.failure: Transaction fails if not enough gas provided
gasLimit.block_limit: Aggregated gasLimit from all transactions in block

alloc.purpose: Pre-allocate ether to accounts from genesis block

geth_startup.important: CHANGE THE 1999 VALUE to unique network ID

parameters.rpc: Enables HTTP-RPC server for wallet connections

metamask.purpose: Browser wallet for interacting with Ethereum

remix_ide.purpose: Browser-based Solidity IDE for smart contract development

steps: Change Environment to Web3 Provider under Run tab
Set Web3 Provider Endpoint to http://localhost:8545

deployment_steps.step1: Click Details button in Remix to see bytecode/ABI
deployment_steps.step2: Under Run tab, select correct ethereum account
deployment_steps.step4: Gas price and value can be zero for testing

cryptokitties_game_guide.concept: Use smart contracts for collectible breeding games

quiz_questions.q: What is the purpose of chainId in genesis.json?
quiz_questions.a: Provides way to send transactions that work on your chain without working on mainnet, ETC, or testnets
quiz_questions.explanation: EIP 155 specifies different chainIds for different networks

quiz_questions.a: Internal pricing for running transactions or contracts - each EVM instruction costs specific amount
quiz_questions.explanation: Transaction fails if required gas not provided before completion

quiz_questions.q: How do you connect Remix IDE to a private network?
quiz_questions.a: Change Environment to Web3 Provider, set endpoint to http://localhost:8545
quiz_questions.explanation: Requires geth to start with --rpccorsdomain "*" flag

quiz_questions.q: What is the 'alloc' field in genesis.json?
quiz_questions.a: Pre-allocates ether to one or more accounts from the genesis block
quiz_questions.explanation: Set up test accounts with balance before network starts

quiz_questions.q: What command unlocks an account for transactions?
quiz_questions.explanation: Must unlock before sending transactions or deploying contracts
